bibl.title: Letter from Clarence P. Jones to Emilie Lawrence Reed, August 13, 1927

div1.p: Jones examines the restored house, in Belroi, and asks when Emilie Lawrence Reed would be available for a dedication ceremony.

div1.head: Letter from Clarence P. Jones to Emilie Lawrence Reed, August 13, 1927
div1.opener:
E.C.S. TALIAFERRO, M.D., CHAIRMAN
NORFOLK, VA.
CLARENCE PORTER JONES, M.D.
NEWPORT NEWS, VA.
GREER BAUGHMAN, M.D.
RICHMOND, VA.
GARNETT NELSON, M.D.
RICHMOND, VA.
H. S. HEDGES, M.D.,
CHARLOTTESVILLE, VA.
Walter Reed Commission
OF THE
Medical Society of Virginia
FOR
ENCOURAGEMENT OF RESEARCH
Newport News, Va. August 13 1927.
Mrs. Walter Reed
Blue Ridge Summit
Pa.
My dear Mrs. Reed:-
div1.p:
I am tardy in acknowledging the receipt of your
letter several days ago. One reason being I wanted to go to the
premises and inspect the result of the effort to restore Belroi.
A letter to Rev. Jas. C. Reed, a copy enclosed will tell you the mainf
facts.

I have instructed the contractor to send you a piece of the
sill which we removed from the lean to (underneath tee head of
the bed where his mother laid when Dr. Reed was born). How little
did she dream that her baby would live to save more lives from an
early death than all the wars for a thousand years have killed.

I am very glad to hear from you, and I am looking forward to
knowing you. Will you write me what will be the earliest date
would suit you to be present at the opening.

Will you write me anything you wish in the matter. I am not
egotistic, only say write to me because the Commission has charged
me as a committee of one to attend to this matter. The rest of the
comissiona are supposed to be busy laying plans to raise the
Million Dollar Research Fund to be placed at the University of
Virginia. In the meantime I am trying to do my task well.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours Clarence Porter Jones CPJ/F.
